subject: design: add Certificate Revocation List (CRL) support
commitMessage:
design: add Certificate Revocation List (CRL) support

This design introduces CRLs into OpenBMC. It proposes DBus interfaces
for CRLs installation, replacement, and deletion.

Change-Id: Iabea908dbbad6bd3fabd66cb8ced03b9d6b46ff2
Signed-off-by: Nan Zhou <nanzhoumails@gmail.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 4:

This change is ready for review.
Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.
Patch Set 7: Published edit on patch set 6.
Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 9d2f47039045751aba72d885b684bb4b31dbf65b
MARRI DEVENDER RAO, could you take an another look?
It has been a week. Could someone take a look? Who can I ask help from? Thanks!
Friendly ping, any comment? Appreciate your time in advance.

I don't haven enough context in phosphor-certificate-manager.
But sounds reasonable.
Benjamin and Brandon, could you help take a look at this design? It's for CRL, after we integrates trust bundle.
Looking pretty reasonable.  Needs the minor formatting and grammar things fixed, then should be good to go.
Background should include context on what a CRL is, as well as the owasp (or similar) security recommendations surrounding them.
Done. I moved some background information from problem description.
nit: rendering this on a markddown viewer, this doesn't come up hyperlinked
Is there a need to propose lower limit on the CRL change frequency ?

That's a good question. I didn't receive any requirement on lower limit from the security team, there's no requirement for trust bundle as well. AFAIK, the rotation interval is at least O(months).

However, this kind of rotation doesn't need power cycle, so we can rollout changes much more quickly than firmware.

As a general rule, that kind of requirement is not for a BMC to enforce.  Generally (at least is the case with certificates) a BMC will update as often as the API user requests.  In practice, there are generally wait timers (usually a second or so), that wait for a change to "settle" to avoid flooding of requests, but in this context, I don't think we need to call that out.
new line for new bullet point?
This sentence doesn't make too much sense for me. Do you mean we notify the consumers of the old CRLs to refresh with the newly given CRLs?
Looks like you forgot a newline?
nit, we can probably omit the things we're not going to do.
nit: no Redfish spec is available
Done. These newlines are messed up by my editor when doing auto-wrap.
nit: prefer the acronym spelled out (the first time) since it isn't in common usage.  At least once in the commit message would be helpful.
Does this need to be 'mTLS' specifically?  Clients otherwise don't have certificates, do they?  (Fix throughout)

That feels like a bit of specifics that isn't neccesarily true.  Technically CRLs could be used on either side of a TLS connection, and the BMC is capable of both producing and consuming a TLS connection, and in theory we could use it for both.

I think it's fine as-is.
Ack.  I guess there is TLS initiated by the BMC for Redfish alerts?
Yep.  EventService can start a connection.
I'd prefer "RevocationList" or something more verbose for the dbus interface name.

How about we just fully spell it out CertificateRevocationList to make it very clear what it is?  Probably something to sort out in the PDI review.  If Nan just removed the 'CRL' from this, and said something like "we propose to introduce a new interface for CRLS in .." then we can argue about the specific naming in the PDI review (which is where that discussion probably belongs anyway) does that work for you?

I see that the Certificate interface has "CertificateString" but it is of type string, so the string is redundant.  I've typically asked for types to not be included.  Is this the name used in Redfish and that's why we went with the type included on it?  (I know in this case you've said for CRL there is no Redfish interface yet)
Same as above, this is probably better taken up in a PDI review.  If Nan makes this more generic at a design doc level, does that work?
Can you expand on the notification process?  I sort of assume it is just a typical InterfacesAdded signal, but I can't tell for certain.

This should probably just say "using the existing phosphor-certificate-manager notification process".  This doesn't intend to change anything about that process (which is a combination of HUP for the things that support it or service restarts for the things that don't).

It probably doesn't make sense to re-document what already exists.
Just made it explicit. Thank you both
I'm not sure this is interesting for the document as it is a pretty trivial remark about code structure.
+1.  This sentence can probably be removed.  Also, it has a typo, so by removing it we solve two things at the same time 😊

Ed gave a +1 on this and Nan was added as an owner to phosphor-certificate-manager recently.  The other two owners have had almost a month to give feedback, so assuming they are fine with this design going forward.
